title: Abstract Wiki Architect Frame Schema: Relational – Comparative / Ranking
description:
JSON schema for `relational.comparative_ranking` frames used by the Abstract Wiki Architect CLI and AW bridge.

The schema describes the normalized payload that will be converted into an internal `ComparativeFrame` (comparative / superlative / ranking facts).

frame_type.description: Canonical frame type identifier. Must be `relational.comparative_ranking`.

subject.description: The primary entity being described (X in 'X is larger than Y').

property.description: The property being compared or ranked, expressed as a lemma-like key, e.g. 'population', 'area', 'age'.

comparison_type.description: Type of comparison: 'comparative' (X larger than Y), 'superlative' (X the largest in domain), or 'ranking' (X is 2nd, 3rd, etc.).

standard.description: Comparison standard entity (Y in 'X is larger than Y'). Used primarily for pure comparative statements.

direction.description: Direction of the comparison with respect to the property: 'greater' (larger, higher, longer...) or 'less' (smaller, lower, shorter...). Defaults to 'greater' in most pipelines.

rank.description: Rank of the subject within the domain for superlative / ranking cases (1 for largest / highest, 2 for second-largest, etc.).

domain.description: Optional domain / set in which the ranking is evaluated, e.g. a country, region, league ('in France', 'in the world').

domain_scope.description: Optional lexical hint for the preposition or scope marker, e.g. 'in', 'among', 'within'. Engines may ignore it and choose their own realization.

subject_quantity.description: Optional explicit numeric value for the subject on the given property (e.g. population figure, area).

standard_quantity.description: Optional explicit numeric value for the standard entity on the given property.

time.description: Optional time span or reference time for which the comparison holds (e.g. 'as of 2020').

certainty.description: Optional certainty or confidence score in [0, 1]. Defaults to 1.0 when omitted.

source_id.description: Optional identifier of the original data source or record from which this comparative fact was derived.

extra.description: Opaque source-specific metadata not interpreted by the core semantics/NLG layer. Use this to carry original IDs, raw fields, or debugging information.

EntityRef.description: Lightweight reference to an entity in the Abstract Wiki knowledge graph or an external source. At least one identifier (`id`, `qid`, or `name`) SHOULD be provided.

id.description: Opaque internal identifier for the entity (database or graph ID).

name.description: Surface name of the entity in a reference language.

lang.description: Optional BCP-47-like language tag for `name`, e.g. 'en', 'fr'.

extra.description: Free-form payload attached to the entity reference.

TimeSpan.description: Approximate or exact time span for an event or state. All fields are optional; callers may encode a single point (`point`) or an interval (`start`/`end`).

start.description: Start of the interval in ISO-8601 form, e.g. '1995-01-01' or '1995-01-01T00:00:00Z'.

end.description: End of the interval in ISO-8601 form.

point.description: Instantaneous timestamp in ISO-8601 form when appropriate.

Quantity.description: Numeric quantity with optional unit, bounds, and time. Designed to match the `Quantity` helper used in relational frames.

unit.description: Unit label, e.g. 'people', 'km', 'USD', '°C', 'points'. May be an empty string when unit is implicit.

approximate.description: If true, the value is approximate (e.g. 'about', 'roughly').

lower_bound.description: Optional lower bound for the quantity.

upper_bound.description: Optional upper bound for the quantity.

extra.description: Free-form payload attached to the quantity (e.g. original units, scaling).
